review: I visited Dr Pooja at the start of second trimester of my pregnancy. Before this, I had seen doctors at reputed hospitals in Mumbai, and can say that she's one of the best gynaecologist in the city that you can find. Pregnancy is not an easy journey, specially when you have complications involved. It's not just her medical advice, but also her counsel and support, which I received from Dr Pooja. Every time I visited her, I came back home with a smile and affirmation of me and my baby being healthy and in safe hands. She was always there to respond to my queries. I had two episodes of bleeding in my first trimester, running across Mumbai and Navi Mumbai consulting different Gynaecs. It was Dr Pooja who figured out the exact cause. I felt a personal care in medication provided by her. When I was put on a daily dose of injection Lonopin, I was scared initially, but she took all care and effort to make me understand reason behind my medication. She never takes queries on her ego, rather gives a definite medical reason behind everything. Among other things, one thing which stood out was that she took complete care and responsibility for the well being of her patient, taking calculated calls based on advice of different specialised medical practitioners. I also had an episode of rheumatoid arthritis where she made sure that the medication I was advised is safe for the baby, even though I was consulting a rheumatologist at the same time. At present I trust her to an extent, that even post delivery, I do not take any medication until confirmed by her. She has cared for me like a doctor and counselled me like a family. A very empathetic person, something that a patient in pain expects from her doctor, and really justifies the job she is in.

review:
DR. POOJA SHUKA

Our meeting with Dr. Pooja was fateful and in my opinion something that destiny had in store for me. So our was an IVF Conception and we were elated at the thought of finally having our first child. We thought it was going to be a smooth ride but unfortunately It wasn‚Äôt to be. For my routine scans and pregnancy follow-ups, I decided to visit the Women‚Äôs Hospital Khar as I & my family had been visiting that hospital for the past 20 years for our gynaecology related issues. Our initial consultations and scans were good. The pregnancy was progressing well and I was on course with my medication & high protein diet which my doctor had advised. However In my 7th month of pregnancy, one of the days I felt that the foetal movements were not the usual. I called the hospital and was asked to come in for a doppler check. The heartbeat was normal and my doctor advised me to come in for a scan the next day. Looking at the scan, the sonologist informed us that my AFI has significantly dropped and from 15 to 9, although the growth parameters were normal until then. My Doctor advised me to go on a high protein diet and take 3 alamine infusions in 9-10 days. I followed and we were asked to get a scan done after 2 weeks. In the follow-up the AFI was stagnant at 8, however the growth parameters had dropped and our baby was not growing as per gestational age. My doctor tagged the slow growth to the low AFI and the mother‚Äôs nutrition not reaching the baby which she said happens. In our follow-up scan after 2 weeks the parameters had fallen even further and my doctor just asked me to keep on with the diet and follow up after 2 weeks. During this entire period my doctor did not think of investigating ‚ÄòWhy the AFI was falling?‚Äô. Considering I reside in Kandivali, we had thought of going to Cloudnine in my last stages of pregnancy to keep it was a backup option in case of emergency. However the circumstances were such that we thought of visiting Cloudnine for a second opinion, we booked an appointment with Dr. Pooja considering her background and reviews. In our first meeting which was 3 days after our last scan, she patiently listened to our entire case history and her first action was to investigate‚Äô Why my AFI was low‚Äô. She explained us the factors why it happens during which she mentioned placental calcification as one of the reasons why AFI and growth reduces. She got a few blood tests done which came out normal. She also got an NST done to check the well being of the baby and a scan done to check on the calcification. The scan confirmed the presence of calcification in the placenta, however looking at the NST she thought lets push it as much as we can with close monitoring to ensure the baby does not have to be in the NICU for long. She gave me an injection to prepare the baby for an early delivery and at the same time put me on a blood thinner injection so that my nutrition can reach the baby. She put us on a closely monitored schedule of 2 scans, 2 NSTs, consultation, some medications to help with the growth and also advised on a diet which directly impacts the baby‚Äôs growth. After a week, we miraculously saw an increase in baby‚Äôs growth, the weight increased from 1760gms to 1962gms to 2114gms in 2 weeks. It was because of her approach that I could enter the 9th month of my pregnancy. After I completed my 35th week she advised us to deliver. She always said,‚Äù You can give the baby all the nutrition it wants once its out, do not crave for 50-60gms of weight increase inside‚Äù. She delivered me and I had baby boy. The baby was doing well except for some grunting which was because of some fluid entering the baby‚Äôs lungs. He was put on oxygen for 4 days after which he was handed over to us. I am glad I met Dr. Pooja at a time when nothing was going right, I am glad she patiently listened to us, guided in the right direction and eventually delivered at the right time. I am and will forever be incredibly grateful to her.
